turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Hashcat.
turn.2: Hashcat  Hashcat is the self-proclaimed world's fastest password recovery tool.
turn.4: It had a proprietary code base until 2015, but is now released as open source software.
turn.6: Versions are available for Linux, OS X, and Windows and can come in CPU-based or GPU-based variants.
turn.7: What has it been used for?
turn.8: Examples of hashcat-supported hashing algorithms are Microsoft LM hashes, MD4, MD5, SHA-family, Unix Crypt formats, MySQL, and Cisco PIX.
turn.9: Is there anything else interesting about it?
turn.10: Hashcat has made its way into the news many times for the optimizations and flaws discovered by its creator, which were exploited in subsequent hashcat releases.
turn.12: (For example, the flaw in 1Password's password manager hashing scheme.) Previously, hashcat used to come in two main variants:  With the release of hashcat v3.00, the GPU and CPU tools were merged into a single tool called hashcat.
